meanings.definition: A person who is easily angered or quick to react aggressively.
meanings.sent1: The hotheads in the room started arguing loudly over a small disagreement.
meanings.sent2: The hotheads in the crowd often got into fights over trivial matters.
meanings.sent3: The hotheads at the party calmed down after some soothing music played.
meanings.sent4: Her temper was like a group of hotheads, ready to explode at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The image of hotheads breathing fire illustrates their quick temper.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals who are impulsive or prone to making rash decisions.
meanings.sent1: The hotheads in the team rushed into a risky plan without thinking it through.
meanings.sent2: The hotheads in the meeting proposed radical changes without considering the consequences.
meanings.sent3: The hotheads at the office party decided to play a prank on their boss.
meanings.sent4: Their impulsive behavior made them a group of hotheads in the eyes of others.
meanings.sent5: The hotheads' reckless actions led to chaos and confusion.
